. 

Halmstad is a popular tourist destination in the summer much because of the beaches

and Östra stranden. But also for its nightlife, with many centrally located outside bars and restaurants that open in the summer. Most tourists come to visit the town in July and August. 

Halmstad is also known as the "
capital" of Sweden with 12 beautiful courses.
Halmstad became a city as early as in 1307 and in the Middle Ages, Halmstad was the largest city on Sweden's west coast.
There is a population of around 90 000 in Halmstad Municipality.
, Halmstad is easy to travel to by both train, bus, bike or car.
The airport in Halmstad is called
and is located 3 kilometers from the city centre. It has connections to
Arlanda airport. The service is run by the aircraft carrier
offering a few trips a day. Alternatively,
-Landvetter Airport are both within 2 hour's drive and an easy train journey to Halmstad and, for more international flights,
(Kastrup) Airport is within 3 hours of Halmstad (via the Oresund bridge).

Halmstad Central station is located a few minutes walk from the city centre.
There are good connections with both

in the northern direction.

National bus lines to Halmstad are run by Swebus Express

, who have connections from most major cities in Sweden.
Hallandstrafiken
is the bus operator in Halland.
The European road E6/E20 passes through Halmstad. Two other important roads to get there are national roads 25 and 26.
Public transportation in Halmstad city is run by
. The city transportation centre is called Österskans bus station.

is a 7 km long beach and in July thousands of people flock there when the weather is fine. Tylösand is believed to be one of the best beaches in Sweden. Watersports like windsurfing and kite boarding are quite popular, and courses are available.

Storgatan and Köpmansgatan, as well as nearby streets, give you various shopping opportunities.

You can pick up the free Entré and Frotté magazines in various stores to read more about Halmstad's nightlife. They are only available in Swedish though.
